title: Eakin–Nagata theorem
summary: In abstract algebra, the Eakin–Nagata theorem states: given commutative rings A ⊂ B {\displaystyle A\subset B} such that B {\displaystyle B} is finitely generated as a module over A {\displaystyle A} , if B {\displaystyle B} is a Noetherian ring, then A {\displaystyle A} is a Noetherian ring.[1] (Note the converse is also true and is easier.)
